column4: hi all. i have a 8 gb mp3 player but ubuntu lucid cant recognized when i connect it with a mini usb to usb. any help please
thanks
what brand mp3 player?
do you see a setting somewhere on the player for the USB connection type?
| it does not appear on nautilus or rythmbox
I meant on the player itself
alright, does this player recognize in Windows?
| it so strange cause it says on the website i google that support all win macs and linux 2.4
I know, I saw that part. I was wondering if maybe it was something with the player (e.g. needed a new battery, etc)
| someone gave it to me cause i wanted to use it like a track to move files and floder from one pc to another
do you have gparted installed on your computer?
alright, just a moment
ok, so can you plug in your player can then run  lsusb   in a terminal?
| the player itself playes song ok with a a AAA battery or without a batter when connected from mini usb to a usb port via cable
| http://paste.ubuntu.com/486696/
| ok, can you try running   sudo lsusb   and see if anything changes?
usually that's not the case
it looks like your player isn't being seen as connected
you could try that
| nothing hapend
ok. ubuntu comes with all the drivers and libraries needed to connect an mp3 player. Could you try a different usb cable?
| i dont have another usb cable :(
ok. unless there is a USB mode on the player itself, I'm not sure what it could be. If you ask someone else, im sure you'll find someone who will know what to do :)
